channel.title: Spectral Plate
channel.description: Well i though i might aswell say this instead of bumping my old post..But ive recently had an accident evolving my model folder so my lunar armor was deleted..but back to the topic i ended up having some spare time during my busy schedule this weekend so i wiped this together..time took making ..approximately 30 minutes making but enjoy..but give me comment CC'c ideas improvements Ect (the armor is shiny OOOO :eek:) i put the sheild with it for comparison [IMG]http://i879.photobucket.com/albums/ab351/Kirikugi_2009/Facewithsheild.png[/img][IMG]http://i879.photobucket.com/albums/ab351/Kirikugi_2009/Face.png[/img]

item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

Not bad. You’re really improving at a decent rate. Keep up the good work. The wire frame could use some work in certain areas, but nothing serious. Why no views of the back? Did you mess the wire frame up? =P Also, the arm is too thin.

item.description:
@kirikugi wrote:

i dont exactly fit it to the 317 model perfectly so i selected the join face of the clothing on the 317 and delete leaving a blank torso and fit it from there…is that what you where asking? and i think im going to make a plate body and stuff to match ALL the spirit sheilds…of cource the other will be nothing more but recolors and emblem changing of this but itll be ok…lol i sorda exspected to get repd for the spectra armor…i cant wait to hit 200

item.title: Spectral Plate
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Same thing I figured out. In meta I was used to just scaling and rotating primitives. Now usually in 3ds I just start with a basic cube or cylinder and extrude. Much better of a method in my opinion.

Read full topic

[quote=“rip4d, post:23, topic:361997”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=458273.msg3353487#msg3353487 date=1285550698]
I suck at art =/ Modeling would be very hard for me.
[/quote]You’d be surprised with what you can do Drawing artistic skills have nothing to do with modeling skills really :|[/quote]But I mean I’m not very creative either lol

Read full topic

item.title: Spectral Plate
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“kirikugi, post:33, topic:361997”]to ob… I CANOT USE BLENDER!! IVE TRYED[/quote]Eh, it grows on you. It took me 6 months to actually start learning it (I’d try once a month, get frustrated and give up), but then I began to love it. I’ll still use Meta for RSPS models and for model competitions, but I’m practicing in Blender a lot. A good way to start modeling would be to learn how to shape things from extruding a circle, its how I’m learning to model, and I actually like it more than how I’m used to modeling in Meta.

Read full topic

item.title: Spectral Plate
item.dc:creator: @Tribbinator Tribbinator
item.description:
@Tribbinator wrote:

Modelling like this does take imagination, but there is also the style of modelling that doesnt take much imagination, such as using reference pictures, but when using reference pictures the imagination is used to figure out HOW to model a section of something, thats the tricky part…Even as a more advanced modeller, it takes alot of crtl-z 'ing to get something just perfect.

Read full topic

item.title: Spectral Plate
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Modelling has nothing to do about your artistic talent but more about your likeliness for art. If you hate drawing or art or even music then you won’t like modelling, but you can still model good. Just it won’t be fun for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Spectral Plate
item.dc:creator: @0bbyme 0bbyme
item.description:
@0bbyme wrote:

kirikugi:

I can only try but im only 15 …looking for a job( just to have a few bucks in my pocket) and doing school work so …i dont have alot of time to practice…maybe 10 hours in a week max

i am 16, with honors classes and am involved in bjj and wrestling during season. you have improved alot and you will keep on improving, i recommend moving on to a better program.
